content:
---

# Page 10



In the context of the insurance policy, the portion of the premium for the unexpired part of any premium payment condition in respect of the Period of Insurance is applicable, provided no claim has been made under the Policy. The Policy may be cancelled by the insured by giving notice to the insurer in writing, provided no claim has arisen during the Period of Insurance and the Letter of Discharge by the Ministry of Manpower is received by the insurer. The date of the Letter of Discharge shall be the cancellation date of the Policy. The insured shall be entitled to a return of premium subject to the short period rates for the period the Policy has been in force as follows:
questions: What conditions must be met for the insured to cancel the policy?
How is the return of premium calculated if the policy is cancelled?
What happens to the premium if a claim has been made under the policy?
What is the significance of the Letter of Discharge from the Ministry of Manpower?
Can the insured cancel the policy at any time during the Period of Insurance?
What is the cancellation date of the policy based on the provided text?
Is there a penalty for cancelling the policy if no claims have been made?
What does 'short period rates' refer to in the context of premium return?
What must the insured provide to the insurer to initiate a cancellation?
What is the relationship between the premium payment condition and the Period of Insurance?
